headline: NewEdge Advisors Recruits $1.4 Billion Team From Ameriprise
summary: NewEdge Advisors has recruited a large team away from  Ameriprise  where the 24-person practice managed $1.4 billion in client assets.  The addition of ClearTrust Advisors, based in Franklin, Tenn., strengthens NewEdge’s presence in the Nashville market.  ClearTrust is led by Joe Creecy, Matt Robins, and Nick Stamatis, who each have the titles of private wealth advisor and managing partner.

headline: Ameriprise Reports Strong Recruiting Amid Competitive Environment
summary: Ameriprise recruited 91 advisors in the fourth quarter, bringing total headcount to 10,503, up 1% year-over-year. CEO Jim Cracchiolo also admitted that there was some attrition last year.

headline: Ameriprise Financial’s (NYSE:AMP) Q4 CY2025: Strong Sales
summary: Financial services company Ameriprise Financial (NYSE:AMP) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 11.1% year on year to $4.96 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $10.83 per share was 5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Ameriprise: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Minneapolis-based company said it had profit of $10.47 per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to $10.83 per share. The results beat Wall Street expectations.
